threads.title: PowerToys setup guide
threads.excerpt:
# PowerToys setup guide

**Date:** 2025-08-29

---

**User:** Hey Fred, I've just downloaded PowerToys on this device and need to do the same on my big boy, my ARM65 Snapdragon laptop. I just want you

learnings.details:
ps1`:

```powershell
param([Parameter(ValueFromRemainingArguments=$true)][string[]]$q)
$prompt = ($q -join ' ')
$apiKey = $env:OPENAI_API_KEY
$body = @{
  model = "gpt-4o-mini"
  messages = @(@{role="user"; content=$prompt})
} | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6
$r = Invoke-RestMethod -Method Post -Uri "https://api. **User:** OK, what about the other AI apps/tools I've never seen before in the Microsoft store? AI Server, AI Suite, AI Client, AI Voice Generation, Local AI Chatbot, AI Human etc?

**Assistant:** Here’s a quick breakdown of what those mystery Microsoft Store “AI” apps likely are—based on their store descriptions—and how they align (or don’t) with our core AI-ecosystem strategy:

---

###  What These “AI…” Apps Actually Are

| App Name                 | Description & Purpose |
|--------------------------|------------------------|
| **AI Client**            | A standalone local app that “brings the full power and flexibility of our AI Suite directly to your device—with no cloud processing involved. - There's no evidence they’re part of Microsoft’s orchestrated AI strategy like Copilot, Magma, or VibeVoice
